meanings.definition: Convert (organic matter) into a mineral substance.
meanings.sent1: The ancient bones were mineralised over time, turning into hard rock.
meanings.sent2: The fallen leaves mineralised into rich soil, perfect for growing plants.
meanings.sent3: The old tree stump was surprised to find itself mineralised into a sparkling crystal.
meanings.sent4: Her memories slowly mineralised into precious gems in the caverns of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The once soft petals mineralised into beautiful, shimmering stones.

meanings.sent1: The mineralised water from the spring provided essential nutrients to the plants.
meanings.sent2: The geologist carefully mineralised the rock samples for analysis in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient was a mineralised salt that enhanced the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent4: The ancient civilization used special rituals to mineralise their weapons for strength in battle.
meanings.sent5: The mineralised lotion promised to nourish and revitalize the skin.

meanings.sent1: The soil mineralised quickly after the volcanic eruption, enriching the land.
meanings.sent2: The wooden shipwreck slowly mineralised underwater, becoming a habitat for marine life.
meanings.sent3: The old mine shaft mineralised over time, creating a glittering underground wonderland.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned building mineralised with moss and lichen, blending into the natural surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The fossilised dinosaur bones mineralised in the ancient riverbed, preserving them for millions of years.
